node.title: Plan to save Canterbury's rare braided rivers on the way
node.description: A new conservation strategy for Canterbury's run-down braided rivers is set to be unveiled this year.

node.title: A year after Capitol riot, hundreds face charges but questions remain
node.description: The dozens of sentences imposed thus far range from probation to over 5 years in prison.

node.title: $29,000 for a used car? Blame inflation.
node.description: "The average person can't afford the average used car right now," one personal finance specialist said.

node.title: Divers find WWII submarine that sank in "rare" naval confrontation
node.description: The Jantina sank on July 5, 1941, with 48 sailors aboard after being hit by torpedoes fired by the HMS Torbay in the Aegean Sea.

node.title: Ross Taylor's school coach: 'The country is proud of him'
node.description: After 400 matches and 40 international centuries, Ross Taylor is retiring from the Black Caps. His old school coach from 20 years ago reflects on the cricket star's career and just how far he's comeâ€¦

node.title: New York A.G. Seeks to Question Trump Children in Fraud Inquiry
node.description: The attorney general, Letitia James, has subpoenaed Donald Trump Jr. and Ivanka Trump as part of a civil investigation.

node.title: How green can Beijing's "green Olympics" really be?
node.description: China has promised a Winter Games to showcase its green credentials, but some call it "irresponsible" to hold an event reliant on snow and ice in a parched landscape.

node.title: Here's when you'll get your Social Security COLA raise
node.description: Seniors will get a hefty 5.9% bump in their checks But some experts doubt it will be enough to offset inflation.

node.title: North Korean defector apparently sneaks back across DMZ to go home
node.description: Officials say a man, reportedly a North Korean who defected to the South about a year ago, has made it back across no man's land. Why would anyone do that?

node.title: FDA authorizes COVID booster shots for Americans as young as 12
node.description: The CDC must also weigh in before the third shots can be rolled out for younger age groups.

node.title: Robo-dogs and therapy bots: Artificial intelligence goes cuddly
node.description: In Japan mechanical companions are finding their way into the hearts of stressed-out adults, schoolchildren, and patients with PTSD or dementia.

node.title: Prince Andrew starts 2022 facing a possible sex abuse trial
node.description: A New York judge is to consider this week whether Virginia Roberts Giuffre's civil sex abuse lawsuit against the British royal should go to trial.

node.title: Brazil's Bolsonaro rushed to hospital for intestinal blockage
node.description: The 66-year-old Brazilian leader was on vacation when he began feeling pain, leading to a swift evacuation in the presidential plane, officials said.

node.title: Fauci says testing requirement under consideration for isolation guidelines
node.description: "I think we're going to be hearing more about that in the next day or so from the CDC," Fauci said.

node.title: Fast-growing Omicron wave could hit India hard
node.description: While its caseload is a fraction of what the U.S. is seeing, India has only vaccinated 63% of its adults, children just started getting jabs this week, and nobody has had a booster shot yet.

node.title: Alert fan's unique warning helps NHL team staffer nip cancer in bud
node.description: Vancouver Canucks assistant equipment manager Brian "Red" Hamilton was behind the bench at a game when he spotted a fan holding up her phone to show him a message that could have been life-saving.

node.title: CES 2022: "The show will and must go on"
node.description: Trends at this year's edition of the annual tech showcase include autonomous race cars,16K TVs and AI everywhere.

node.title: 200-million-year-old dinosaur footprints discovered on beach
node.description: Researchers believe that the area may have once been a trample ground in the Triassic period for sauropodomorphs â€” massive, herbivorous, long-necked dinosaurs.

node.title: Marjorie Taylor Greene's personal Twitter account permanently suspended
node.description: Marjorie Taylor Greene has been suspended from Twitter, again. This time it is permanent, the social network said.

node.title: Biden tells Ukraine's president U.S. will act "decisively" if Russia invades
node.description: The president spoke with Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelensky on Sunday amid heightening tensions in the region.

node.title: Gottlieb says Omicron appears to be a "milder strain" of COVID-19, but pediatric danger remains
node.description: Gottlieb also noted that places that have been hard hit early by Omicron are as soon as "two weeks away from peaking, but the rest of the country probably faces a hard month ahead of us."

node.title: Explaining Web3: Should you believe the hype?
node.description: Experts explain what's behind the year's biggest technology buzzword and the players that are driving its marketing.

node.title: Winter Storm Knocks Out Power Across Southeast
node.description: Hundreds of thousands were without electricity on Monday, and federal government offices in the Washington, D.C., area were closed because of the storm.

node.title: Missing teens rescued by Coast Guard after writing "SOS" in snow
node.description: The Coast Guard released video of the rescue, showing one of the hikers being hoisted into a helicopter.

node.title: Man bought Lamborghini, Rolex, more with COVID funds, feds say
node.description: Federal prosecutors say Valesky Barosy, 27, of Fort Lauderdale, Florida used COVID-19 relief money to buy $2.2 million in luxury items such as a Lamborghini and Rolex watches.

node.title: Online â€˜Auctionâ€™ Is Latest Attack on Muslim Women in India
node.description: The fake site, the second in months, is a sign of the organized nature of virtual bullying, with threats of sexualized violence aimed at silencing the outspoken.

node.title: How Beijing Has Muted Hong Kongâ€™s Independent Media
node.description: Citizen News, a small but aggressive online publication, is the latest outlet to fold amid relentless pressure from the authorities.

node.title: 2 women choke to death on New Year's rice cakes
node.description: Every year, Japan issues public warnings to be careful when eatingÂ mochi -- and nearly every year, people choke to death anyway.

node.title: President Jair Bolsonaro of Brazil Is Hospitalized, Local Reports Say
node.description: Mr. Bolsonaro has previously undergone surgeries related to serious stabbing wounds he suffered while on the campaign trail in 2018.

node.title: "No worries" and "circle back" among annual list of banished phrases
node.description: There are only three entries associated with the pandemic this year after it dominated last year's list.
